COMMENT_TX: $Bill Dickey bluffed a throw to 2B and ran towards charging Bob Johnson; when Dickey realized he couldn't catch Johnson, Dickey threw towards Red Rolfe but it hit Johnson's shoulder and went into LF

ej,dykej101,M,kolll901,Called third strike ej,haasm101,P,kolll901,Abusive language $Zeke Bonura argued the called third strike; White Sox manager Jimmy Dykes came out to argue that call and the fact that pitcher George Caster was not standing on the pitching rubber while throwing; Dykes was ejected by HP umpire Lou Kolls; Kolls then told Caster to start pitching to Luke Appling even though Appling was not in the batter's box; after two strikes, Dykes stood on the top step of the dugout and told Kolls that he was playing the game under protest; Mule Haas also ejected by Kolls
$the popup in front of plate glanced off Merv Shea's glove into foul territory
$1B umpire Bill Summers called Red Ruffing out but HP umpire Bill Dinneen overuled Summers; this allowed Powell to score
$George Selkirk fell after the catch and left with an injured shoulder
$pitcher Lynn Nelson played LF
$pitcher Lynn Nelson played LF
$game called due to rain
$Lefty Grove left the game due to the excessive heat

$Wally Moses rounded 2B too far

$Connie Mack stayed home with stomach ailment; Earl Mack managed Athletics
